entry.title: Kalmia Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Kalmia Club (clubhouse pictured) is named after the mountain laurel?

entry.title: Martina Fernández (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Martina Fernández plays football for Barcelona and studies part-time at a biomedical laboratory?

entry.title: dumping sewage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Southern Water was fined £90 million for deliberately dumping sewage into the sea?

entry.title: Princess Zelda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Princess Zelda's name was inspired by American novelist and socialite Zelda Fitzgerald?

entry.title: Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a bus-chase sequence in Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings took more than a year to plan and was revised more than twenty times?

entry.title: Al Sweet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that cornetist Al Sweet dressed his band, the White Hussars, in flashy white-and-gold military uniforms based on hussars?

entry.title: the 400th episode (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 400th episode of Neighbours features the serial's first ever Christmas story?

entry.title: Ioniță Tunsu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a street in Bucharest was once named after Ioniță Tunsu, an outlaw who used to visit his girlfriend there?
